sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
Gets a list of Autonomous Databases.

Inputs :

  • Compartment ID - The OCID of the compartment of the Autonomous Database.
  • Sort By - The field to sort by.
  • Sort Order - The sort order to use. The default order is Ascending.
  • Infrastructure Type - A filter to return only resources that match the given Infrastructure Type.
  • Lifecycle State - A filter to return only resources that match the given lifecycle state exactly.
  • Database Workload - A filter to return only autonomous database resources that match the specified workload type.
  • Is Free Tier - Filter on the value of the resource's 'isFreeTier' property.
  • Display Name - A filter to return only resources that match the entire display name given. The match is not case sensitive.
  • Is Data Guard Enabled - A filter to return only resources that have Data Guard enabled.

Outputs :

  • Status - If the request is executed successfully, Status is set to "Success". If there is a failure, Status is set to "Error".
  • Error Message - Reason for error, along with code. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • Output - A list of JSON objects with Database Name and Database ID.
  • Databases List - The entire JSON response comprising the database information.

Error Messages :

  • Bad Request.
  • Unauthorized.
  • Not Found.
  • Internal Server Error.

To use this action, the corresponding Oracle connection and credential must be created and associated with the Oracle Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
